subject: Psychology
paper: A-level Paper 3 â€“ Issues and options in psychology
papersSampled: June 2018 QP - Paper 3 AQA Psychology A-level_extracted.txt
markingPrinciples: Apply a level of response marking scheme, starting from the lowest level and working up.
Use indicative content as a guide but credit other valid points.
Focus on the balance of AO1, AO2, and AO3, particularly in extended responses.
Consider the clarity, coherence, and focus of the response, as well as the use of specialist terminology.
Use a best-fit approach when responses cover aspects of different levels.

aoEmphasis.AO1: Judged based on accurate and detailed knowledge of psychological theories, studies, and concepts relevant to issues and debates and chosen option topics.
aoEmphasis.AO2: Assessed through the application of psychological knowledge to scenarios, stems, or data provided in the questions, demonstrating understanding in context.
aoEmphasis.AO3: Evaluated based on the depth and quality of analysis, evaluation, and discussion, including the use of evidence, counter-arguments, and consideration of methodological issues.

levelDescriptorsSummary: Low band: Basic knowledge, limited application, and superficial evaluation with little depth.
Mid band: Accurate knowledge with some detail, appropriate application, and some effective evaluation.
High band: Comprehensive knowledge, effective application, and thorough evaluation with well-developed arguments.
commonStrengths: Clear and coherent outlines of psychological concepts and theories.
Ability to apply knowledge to novel scenarios or data.
commonWeaknesses: Superficial evaluation lacking depth or detail.
Failure to adequately apply knowledge to the specifics of the question stem.
Over-reliance on rote-learned content without adaptation to the question.
topBandAdvice: Ensure a balanced response with appropriate AO1, AO2, and AO3 coverage.
Develop evaluation points thoroughly with evidence and counter-arguments.
Integrate issues and debates effectively into your discussion.
typicalQuestionTypes: 16-mark 'discuss' questions requiring balanced AO1, AO2, and AO3.
24-mark option essays focusing on depth and breadth of knowledge and evaluation.
Questions requiring application of psychological knowledge to scenarios or data.
feedbackTone: Feedback should be firm but supportive, focusing on exam technique and specific improvements in AO1, AO2, and AO3, with attention to detail in option topics.
